info.title: ModelsLab Image Editing API
info.description: Image editing endpoints for ModelsLab API including background removal, super resolution, face generation, fashion try-on, and various image manipulation tools

post.description: This endpoint removes background from image and create mask
Super Resolution API returns a super resolution version of an image that is passed to the init_image attribute
This endpoint allows you to caption image.
This endpoint allows you to upload image in base64 format and get it in url format

post.summary: Generate image from text and reference images (Flux Kontext Model)
post.description: The Image to Image API is used to create high-quality images from text prompts combined with reference images using the Flux Kontext model. This endpoint allows you to blend elements from multiple input images guided by text descriptions.

200.description: Flux Kontext Image to Image generation response

post.description: This endpoint allows you to generate image with the face image provided
This endpoint allows you to wear a cloth image sample on an existing model body
This endpoint allows you to edit images using Qwen model
Fetch Queued Images API fetches queued images from stable diffusion processing

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the queued image request

post.description: This endpoint allows you to generate head shot with flux capabilities (Enterprise feature)
This endpoint allows you to generate head shot image
This endpoint generates image by mixing multiple images
This endpoint generates and returns an image from an image and a mask passed with their URLs in the request
This endpoint helps to mask an object on a given image
This endpoint helps to remove object from an existing image
This endpoint helps to outpaint by expanding the given image

inverse_mask.description: This will inverse the generated mask

key.description: Your API Key used for request authorization

prompt.description: The text prompt to guide image generation

negative_prompt.description: Aspects to avoid in the generated image

image.description: URL of the initial image to outpaint

overlap_width.description: Width of the mask overlap area

guidance_scale.description: How closely to follow the prompt

base64.description: Whether the image is base64 encoded

webhook.description: URL to receive POST API call when complete

key.description: Your API Key used for request authorization.

model_id.description: The ID of the model. Must be 'flux-kontext-dev' for Flux Kontext model.

prompt.description: A text description of the things you want in the generated image, referencing elements from the input images.

negative_prompt.description: Items you don't want in the image. Helps exclude unwanted elements, artifacts, or styles from the generation.

init_image.description: URL of the primary reference image to use as a base for the generation.

init_image_2.description: URL of the secondary reference image to incorporate elements from. Optional for single-image workflows.

safety_checker.description: Whether to run the safety checker

num_inference_steps.description: The number of denoising steps. Values typically range from 1 to 50. Can be provided as integer or string.

strength.description: Controls how much the output image should resemble the input image. 0.0 means identical to input, 1.0 means completely different. Can be provided as number or string.

guidance.description: Scale for classifier-free guidance. Higher values make the model follow the prompt more closely. Can be provided as number or string.

enhance_prompt.description: Enhance prompts for better results. Set to null to use model defaults.

width.description: The width of the output image in pixels. Maximum value is 1024.

height.description: The height of the output image in pixels. Maximum value is 1024.

samples.description: The number of images to be returned in response. Maximum value is 4.

seed.description: Used to reproduce results. The same seed will generate the same image again. Pass null for a random number.

base64.description: Get response as a base64 string.

webhook.description: URL to receive a POST API call once image generation is complete.

track_id.description: This ID is returned in the response to the webhook API call and is used to identify the webhook request.

temp.description: Create a temporary image link valid for 24 hours.

generationTime.description: Time taken to generate the image in seconds.

id.description: Unique identifier for the image generation request.

meta.description: Metadata about the image generation including all parameters used.

nsfw_content_detected.description: Indicates if NSFW content was detected in the generated image.

eta.description: Estimated time for completion in seconds.

fetch_result.description: URL to fetch the result when processing.

id.description: Unique identifier for the image generation request.

meta.description: Metadata about the image generation including all parameters used.

future_links.description: Array of future image URLs for queued requests.

generationTime.description: Time taken to generate the image in seconds

id.description: Unique identifier for the generation request

fetch_result.description: URL to fetch the result when ready

id.description: Unique identifier for the generation request

message.description: Error message describing what went wrong

id.description: Unique identifier for the generation request
